title: Turbine Power Curves
description: Define a set of power curves for a wind turbine.

rated_power.title: Rated power [W]
rated_power.description: Nominal rated power of the turbine in W. Used for preliminary sizing and search. This value may be overridden on a per-mode basis.

cut_in_rpm.title: Rotational speed at cut-in [RPM]
cut_in_rpm.description: Nominal rotational speed at cut-in (specify 0 for stall-regulated devices) [RPM]. This value may be overriden on a per-mode basis.

rated_rpm.title: Rotational speed at rated power [RPM]
rated_rpm.description: Nominal rotational speed at rated power (or at peak power for stall-regulated devices) [RPM]. This value may be overriden on a per-mode basis.

available_hub_heights.title: Available hub heights
available_hub_heights.description: Specify either a discrete list or a continuous range of available hub heights [m]. This value may be overriden on a per-mode basis.

anyOf.title: Specify a range of available hub heights [m]
anyOf.description: Specify a range of available hub heights [m]

anyOf.title: Specify a list of discrete available hub heights [m]
anyOf.description: Specify a list of discrete available hub heights [m]

grid_frequencies.title: Grid frequencies [Hz]
grid_frequencies.description: The allowable design grid frequencies in Hz

document.title: Document
document.$comment: We've added metadata into a property of `document` to facilitate addition of more prescriptive or specific (ie non dublin-core) properties in the future

metadata.title: Dublin-Core Metadata
metadata.description: Add metadata according to the Dublin Core Metadata Initiative (DCMI) elements/1.1. See https://www.dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/dcmi-terms/#section-3 for detailed information on each element.

turbine.title: Turbine
turbine.description: General information about the physical turbine and its default operational values

manufacturer_name.title: Manufacturer name
manufacturer_name.description: Full name of the manufacturer (eg a legal entity)

manufacturer_display_name.title: Manufacturer display name
manufacturer_display_name.description: Shortened or informal name of the manufacturer (for display purposes, eg in dropdown selectors). See also manufacturer_name.

model_name.title: Model name
model_name.description: Name of the turbine model as stated on the Type Certificate, Design Evaluation Confirmity Statement or Statement of Compliance.

model_description.title: Model description
model_description.description: General description about the turbine model, eg for giving a brief overview in a turbine selection tool.
examples: An example simple turbine with only one mode.

platform_name.title: Platform name
platform_name.description: Optional name of the platform on which this turbine model is based.

platform_description.title: Platform description
platform_description.description: Optional general description of the platform on which this turbine model is based.
examples: The 1.x Series platform was designed as a basis for a range of small-scale onshore turbines versatile for a range of site conditions.

rotor_diameter.title: Rotor diameter [m]
rotor_diameter.description: Nominal rotor diameter of the turbine [m]

drive_type.title: Drive type
drive_type.description: The drive type of the turbine

regulation_type.title: Regulation type
regulation_type.description: The regulation type of the turbine.

design_bases.title: Design bases
design_bases.description: A list of design bases for turbine certification or describing site-specific environmental conditions. Each contains information about the design point (environmental conditions) for which the power curves in this document are intended.

label.title: Basis label
label.description: A string key identifying the design basis, eg `my_design_basis_1`

name.title: Basis name
name.description: A human-readable name matching this basis label (eg for use in UIs)

certification.title: Certification details
certification.description: Information about the scheme under which this design basis was certified. This is not a required property, so if a turbine is as-yet uncertified, simply leave it out.
certification.$comment: We collect these three under a single 'certification' property as a convenient way to require that either all or none are given

standard.$comment: The use of anyOf allows specification of any string value, whilst adding an enum to indicate the precise values to be selected should your value be in the prescribed list of common items.
standard.description: The certification scheme under which the power curves were certified.

standard_edition.$comment: The use of anyOf allows specification of any string value, whilst adding an enum to indicate the precise values to be selected should your value be in the prescribed list of common items.
standard_edition.description: The edition of the standard used in turbine certification

certificate_reference.title: Certificate reference
certificate_reference.description: Identifies the certificate associated with the power curve. Note that multiple design bases may refer to the same certificate.

design_class.title: Design class
design_class.description: A fully or partially predefined environmental class, (eg IEC or other scheme)

oneOf.title: Standard IEC design class

class_label.description: Select from predefined IEC design classes I, II, and III.

oneOf.$comment: TODO Schema team - what should we do for class IV turbines? Are they custom?

class_label.title: Label
class_label.description: Specify IEC classes S, T, CC or an entirely custom design class

annual_average_wind_speed.title: Annual average wind speed 'Vave'
annual_average_wind_speed.description: The annualised average wind speed for which the turbine is certified [m/s]

annual_average_air_density.title: Annual average air density 'rho'
annual_average_air_density.description: The annualised average air density for which the turbine is certified [kg/m^3]

reference_wind_speed.title: Reference wind speed 'Vref'
reference_wind_speed.description: The 50-year return value of 10-minute average wind speed for which the turbine is certified [m/s]. Note: the Ve50 (the 3s gust wind speed) can be calculated from V50 according to the standard ratio

weibull_shape_factor.title: Weibull shape factor, 'k'
weibull_shape_factor.description: The Weibull distribution shape factor k [dimensionless]. Tip: You can calculate the Weibull scale factor, 'c', from the weibull_shape_factor and the annual_average_wind_speed.

vertical_shear_exponent.title: Vertical shear exponent 'alpha'
vertical_shear_exponent.description: The design wind vertical shear exponent [dimensionless]

design_lifetime.$comment: Schema team - check if this also needs to be given for T, CC classes as well as S class
design_lifetime.title: Design lifetime
design_lifetime.description: Designed lifetime of the turbine in years, typically 20. Note that some design classes require particular minimum lifetimes.

turbulence.title: Turbulence category or distribution
turbulence.description: Specify the IEC turbulence category or one of several custom distributions.

anyOf.title: Standard IEC Turbulence Category
anyOf.$comment: This is defined as a single-property object rather than a direct string because it's more explicit to include the category keyword (and allows for later adoption of other predefined profiles requiring more sophistication than a string)

category.title: Category
category.description: Specify a predefined IEC turbulence category

anyOf.title: Custom Iref and slope parameters
anyOf.description: Specify custom fixed Iref and optional slope parameter

category.title: Category
category.description: Specify the turbulence category to be custom

reference_turbulence_intensity.title: Turbulence intensity
reference_turbulence_intensity.description: Characteristic Iref value at 15m/s, specified as a fraction (eg 0.13)

slope.title: Slope (a)
slope.description: Specify the slope parameter (a) for use with edition 2 definitions of turbulence. Typical values are 2 or 3. No slope parameter is used for editions 3 or 4.

anyOf.title: Normal and Extreme Turbulence Models varying with Wind Speed
anyOf.description: Specify Normal and Extreme Turbulence Models (NTM, ETM) using turbulence intensity as a function of wind speed

category.title: Category
category.description: Specify the turbulence category as custom

wind_speed.title: Wind Speed
wind_speed.description: Wind speed in m/s for each entry in the Normal and Extreme Turbulence Model arrays. Wind speed range must cover the entire operating range (below cut-in to above maximum cut-out).

normal_turbulence_intensity.title: Normal Turbulence Intensity
normal_turbulence_intensity.description: Normal value of I for each wind speed, specified as a fraction (eg 0.13)

extreme_turbulence_intensity.title: Extreme Turbulence Intensity
extreme_turbulence_intensity.description: Extreme value of I for each wind speed, specified as a fraction (eg 0.13)

anyOf.title: Normal and Extreme Turbulence Models varying with Wind Speed and Lifetime Hours
anyOf.description: Specify Normal Turbulence Model as a function of wind speed and lifetime hours, and Extreme Turbulence Models (NTM, ETM) as a function of wind speed.

category.description: Set the turbulence category to custom

wind_speed.title: Wind Speed
wind_speed.description: Wind speed in m/s for each entry in the Normal and Extreme Turbulence Model arrays. Wind speed range must cover the entire operating range (below cut-in to above maximum cut-out).

normal_turbulence_intensity.title: Normal Turbulence Intensity
normal_turbulence_intensity.description: 2d array containing normal value of I for each wind speed (row) and probability interval (column), specified as a fraction (eg 0.13). Probability intervals represent evenly spaced bins covering the domain [0,1].

normal_hours_per_lifetime.title: Normal hours per lifetime [h]
normal_hours_per_lifetime.description: 2d array containing the number of hours spent, through-life, for each wind speed (row) and probability interval (column) [h]

extreme_turbulence_intensity.title: Extreme Turbulence Intensity
extreme_turbulence_intensity.description: Extreme value of I for each wind speed, specified as a fraction (eg 0.13)

standard_climate.description: Define operating and survival temperatures in standard (usual) climates

cold_climate.description: Define operating and survival temperatures in cold climates
cold_climate.$comment: TODO Schema team - Can we define why this is different in cold climates than it is in standard climates?

hot_climate.description: Define operating and survival temperatures in hot climates
hot_climate.$comment: TODO Schema team - Can we define why this is different in hot climates than it is in standard climates?

power_curves.title: Power Curves
power_curves.description: Contains power and thrust curves along with data specific to each operational mode of the turbine

default_mode.title: Default mode
default_mode.description: The label of the mode that should be used by default (must match an entry in 'modes')

modes.title: Modes
modes.description: Different modes that the turbine can operate in / switch between

label.title: Mode label
label.description: A string key identifying the mode, e.g. `power_optimised_1`

name.title: Mode name
name.description: A human-readable name for the mode, e.g. `Power Optimised 1 (PO1)`

design_bases.description: A list of the design basis labels relevant to this power curve

description.title: Mode description
description.description: Short human readable text describing the purpose of this mode, which will be rendered into dropdowns and made searchable.
examples: For general purpose operation in standard climates, or early stage site design
For use in noise-reduced situations eg close to population areas or sites of special scientific interest

cuts.title: Cut in and cut out conditions
cuts.description: A list of the cut in and out conditions relevant to this power curve

kind.title: Cut in characteristic
kind.description: Select the kind of cut in characteristic to apply

wind_speed.title: Reference wind speed [m/s]
wind_speed.description: The wind speed at which the cut in/out will apply [m/s]

period.title: Period [s]
period.description: The number of seconds that the reference wind speed is met to apply the cut in/out action [s]

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: Independent parameters for which the power and thrust curves are described

label.title: Parameter label
label.description: A slugified string key used to identify the parameter (e.g. air-density).

dimension.title: Dimension
dimension.description: Dimension of the power curve array along which this parameter varies (0-based)

values.title: Air Density Values
values.description: Values of air density [kg/m^3] for which this power curve is tabulated

values.title: Wind Speed Values
values.description: Values of free-stream wind speed [m/s] at hub height for which this power curve is tabulated

values.title: Turbulence Intensity Values
values.description: Values of turbulence intensity I [-] (expressed as a factor in the range 0,1 rather than a percentage) for which this power curve is tabulated

values.title: Turbulence Lengthscale Values
values.description: Values of turbulence integral lengthscale l [m] for which this power curve is tabulated

values.title: Monin-Obukhov Stability Values
values.description: Values of the the Monin-Obukhov stability parameter zeta [-] for which this power curve is tabulated. Values of zero indicate neutral conditions, vegative condi

values.title: Shear Coefficient Values
values.description: Values of wind shear coefficient alpha [-] for which this power curve is tabulated

values.title: Wind Direction Values
values.description: Values of wind direction [???? degrees clockwise from true north????] for which this power curve is tabulated

cp_is_coefficient.title: Cp is Coefficient
cp_is_coefficient.description: True if the `cp` array is in nondimensional coefficient form, False if the `cp` array contains Power [W].

ct_is_coefficient.title: Ct is Coefficient
ct_is_coefficient.description: True if the `ct` array is in nondimensional coefficient form, False if the `ct` array contains Thrust [kgms^-2].

cp.title: Power Curve [cp]
cp.description: The coefficient of power, defined as an N-D array at the sample points described in 'Parameters'

oneOf.title: 2 Parameters (2D Array, e.g. air-density and wind-speed)
3 Parameters (3D Array, e.g. turbulent-intensity, air-density and wind-speed)
4 Parameters (4D Array, e.g. monin-obukhov-stability, turbulent-intensity, air-density and wind-speed)

ct.title: Thrust Curve [ct]
ct.description: The coefficient of thrust, defined as an N-D array at the sample points described in 'Parameters'

oneOf.title: 2 Parameters (2D Array, e.g. air-density and wind-speed)
3 Parameters (3D Array, e.g. turbulent-intensity, air-density and wind-speed)
4 Parameters (4D Array, e.g. monin-obukhov-stability, turbulent-intensity, air-density and wind-speed)

acoustic_emissions.title: Acoustic emissions
acoustic_emissions.description: Specify the noise (Sound Pressure Level) emitted by the turbine in this mode of operation
acoustic_emissions.$comment: This property is not required, in order to facilitate backward compatibility (entering data from existing power curve data sheets which may not contain this data). OEMs should treat this as required, however, and future versions of the standard should consider moving to requiring this field.

weighting.title: Weighting
weighting.description: Weighting filter that has been applied to sound pressure level measurements (see IEC 61672:2003 for definitions of curves).

wind_speed.title: Wind speed
wind_speed.description: Array of wind speed values, referred to hub height, for which the Sound Pressure Levels are given. The length of this array must match the leading dimension of the Sound Pressure Level matrix and the length of hte total_sound_pressure_level array.

sound_pressure_level.title: Sound Pressure Level
sound_pressure_level.description: The sound pressure level [db], specified as a matrix for a range of wind speeds and frequencies.
sound_pressure_level.$comment: The sound_pressure_level property is not required for the same reason that its parent, the `acoustic_emissions` property is not required. It is however strongly recommended, again for the same reason.

anyOf.$comment: Schema team: We decided not to include actual frequency ranges, which would have to be an enum specified within a sound_pressure_level object, to avoid requiring a schema for constant data and to simplify the overall pattern.
anyOf.title: Sound Pressure Level (one-third octave intervals)
anyOf.description: A matrix of sound pressure levels, one for each wind speed in the `wind_speed` property, and for frequencies in 1/3 octave intervals (29 values: [25, 31, 40, 50, 63, 80, 100, 125, 160, 200, 250, 315, 400, 500, 630, 800, 1000, 1250, 1600, 2000, 2500, 3150, 4000, 6300, 8000, 10000, 12500, 16000, 20000] hz).

anyOf.$comment: TODO Schema team - find the reference from which these frequency ranges originated - possibly https://www.engineeringtoolbox.com/octave-bands-frequency-limits-d_1602.html.
anyOf.title: Sound Pressure Level (full octave intervals)
anyOf.description: A matrix of sound pressure levels, one for each wind speed in the `wind_speed` property, and for frequencies in full octave intervals (10 values: [31, 63, 125, 250, 500, 1000, 2000, 4000, 8000, 16000] hz).

total_sound_pressure_level.title: Total Sound Pressure Level
total_sound_pressure_level.description: The total sound pressure level [db], summated across the frequency range using the specified weighting, for each of the specified wind speeds

overrides.title: Mode-Specific Overrides
overrides.description: Override of certain data in the `turbine` section, where that data conflicts with requirements of a mode. For example, some operating modes may reduce rated power, or require a more restrictive range of hub heights for structural reasons
